content: The Program - Birth Chart Feature Implementation Complete (Oct 25, 2025): Successfully implemented full birth chart overlay system for the Cosmic Visualizer. Features include: birth chart form with location/date/time input, chart manager for saving/loading multiple charts, natal planet 3D overlay with pulsing animations, transit-to-natal aspect lines, localStorage persistence, and full UI integration with toggle controls. Located in frontend/src/features/cosmos/ and lib/astronomy/birthChart.ts

The Program - Geocoding Feature Added (Oct 25, 2025): Implemented automatic location search with geocoding for Birth Chart form. Uses OpenStreetMap Nominatim (free) for location search and coordinate retrieval, plus timeapi.io for timezone detection. Features type-ahead autocomplete, auto-population of lat/lon/timezone, manual override option, and visual feedback. Located in frontend/src/lib/services/geocoding.ts and updated BirthChartForm.tsx

The Program - Geocoding Tests Complete (Oct 25, 2025): Created comprehensive test suite for geocoding feature with 23 passing unit tests covering searchLocation, getTimezone, validateCoordinates, formatCoordinates, and debounce functions. Also created integration tests for BirthChartForm with geocoding, plus mock data helpers. All tests passing (100% success rate). Files: geocoding.test.ts, BirthChartForm.geocoding.test.tsx, geocoding.mocks.ts

TheProgram project dev workflow:
- Frontend runs in Docker container on port 3000 
- To deploy changes: 
  1. Edit files in /home/sylvia/ClaudeWork/TheProgram/frontend/
  2. Run: docker compose build --no-cache frontend  
  3. Run: docker compose up -d frontend
  4. User refreshes http://localhost:3000/
- Do NOT run multiple npm dev servers
- Docker handles the serving

TheProgram deployment issue: Changes to Planet.tsx footprint display not appearing in Docker build despite:
- Code confirmed in source file (/home/sylvia/ClaudeWork/TheProgram/frontend/src/features/cosmos/components/Planet.tsx lines 215-636)
- Build completing successfully
- Container rebuilt with --no-cache
- Need to investigate: possible tree-shaking, minification issues, or runtime errors preventing render
- Symptoms: formattedDegree, gateNumber code not found in bundled index-CGZ_9wkW.js

Cosmic Visualizer Bottom Panel Analysis Complete (2025-11-06)

ANALYSIS SUMMARY:
- File: /home/sylvia/ClaudeWork/TheProgram/frontend/src/features/cosmos/CosmicVisualizerPage.tsx
- Lines 1997-2123: Time Controls/Bottom Panel
- Current Height: 230-260px (35-40% of viewport)
- Potential Savings: 180-210px (78-81% reduction when collapsed)

KEY COMPONENTS FOUND:
1. Date/Time Display (lines 1999-2026) - 70px
2. Playback Controls (lines 2028-2066) - 45px  
3. Date Presets (lines 2068-2088) - 50px (6 astronomical date presets)
4. Fine Step Controls (lines 2091-2121) - 45px

STYLING:
- Uses "glass-strong" CSS class (80% opacity dark purple, 20px blur)
- Tailwind CSS: px-3 py-1.5 button padding, gap-2 spacing
- All cosmic theme colors defined in tailwind.config.js

EXISTING INFRASTRUCTURE:
✓ CollapsibleSection component exists (lines 219-244)
✓ State management ready: collapsedSections object (lines 280-288)
✓ Icons imported: ChevronDown, etc.
✓ No new dependencies needed!

RECOMMENDED IMPLEMENTATION (Phase 1 - 30 mins):
1. Add 'bottom-panel': false to collapsedSections state (line 288)
2. Wrap bottom panel with CollapsibleSection component (line 1997)
3. Update toggle function
4. Test in browser

DOCUMENTATION GENERATED (49KB total):
1. COSMIC_ANALYSIS_INDEX.md - Navigation guide (START HERE)
2. COSMIC_PANEL_SUMMARY.txt - Executive summary
3. COSMIC_BOTTOM_PANEL_ANALYSIS.md - Technical details
4. COSMIC_PANEL_QUICK_REFERENCE.md - Quick lookup
5. COSMIC_PANEL_IMPLEMENTATION_GUIDE.md - Step-by-step instructions

All files in: /home/sylvia/ClaudeWork/TheProgram/

RISK LEVEL: Minimal (infrastructure exists, reuse proven patterns)
CONFIDENCE: High (infrastructure ready, low-effort implementation)

Electron Desktop App POC Investigation - TheProgram

BRANCH: desktop-electron-poc (latest commit: 94a60db)
STATUS: Proof of Concept Complete & Verified Working

CORE ARCHITECTURE:
- Electron main process spawns Python FastAPI backend as subprocess
- React frontend loads in Electron renderer process
- All IPC via localhost (port 8000 backend, port 3001 dev server)
- No CORS issues, simplified network model

KEY FILES CREATED:
1. electron/main.ts (186 lines) - Main process entry point
   - App lifecycle management (ready, quit, window-all-closed, activate, before-quit)
   - BrowserWindow creation with security hardening (context isolation, no Node integration, sandbox)
   - Dev mode: loads from Vite dev server http://localhost:3001
   - Prod mode: loads from frontend/dist/index.html
   - Opens DevTools in development mode

2. electron/python-manager.ts (172 lines) - Python subprocess controller
   - Spawns Python via virtual environment (test_venv/bin/python3)
   - Dev mode: runs 'python -m uvicorn app.main:app --host 0.0.0.0 --port 8000'
   - Prod mode: uses bundled executable at process.resourcesPath
   - Monitors stdout/stderr for 'Uvicorn running' message (5sec timeout fallback)
   - Graceful shutdown: tree-kill SIGTERM with SIGKILL fallback
   - No orphan processes guaranteed

3. electron/preload.ts (40 lines) - Security bridge
   - Exposes safe IPC methods: getApiUrl(), isDev(), getVersion(), getUserDataPath()
   - Context bridge pattern prevents renderer access to Node.js
   - All access via ipcRenderer.invoke()

4. electron/tsconfig.json - TypeScript compilation config
   - Target: ES2020, CommonJS modules
   - Output: dist/electron/
   - Declaration files & source maps enabled

PACKAGE.JSON UPDATES:
- Main entry: "dist/electron/main.js"
- Dependencies: tree-kill (1.2.2) for reliable process termination
- DevDependencies: electron (39.2.1), electron-builder (26.0.12), typescript (5.9.3), concurrently (9.2.1)

NPM SCRIPTS:
- electron:compile: tsc compile TypeScript
- electron:dev: NODE_ENV=development electron . --no-sandbox
- electron:start: compile + dev (full startup)
- dev:all: concurrent watch of electron/frontend/backend + 3sec delay before electron:dev
- build:all: build frontend + electron
- dist:linux: package as AppImage/deb via electron-builder
- dist: build all + package

ELECTRON-BUILDER CONFIG (in package.json):
- appId: com.theprogram.desktop
- productName: "The Program"
- Files: dist/**, package.json
- Extra Resources:
  - frontend/dist → frontend/dist
  - backend/dist/backend → backend/backend
- Output directory: release/
- Linux targets: AppImage, deb
- Icon: build/icon.png (exists, 9.15MB PNG)

BUILD/COMPILED FILES:
- dist/electron/main.js (165 lines, 5.8KB)
- dist/electron/preload.js (36 lines, 987B)
- dist/electron/python-manager.js (156 lines, 6.1KB)
- Total TypeScript compiled: ~13KB
- All include source maps (.js.map) and type definitions (.d.ts)
- Size: 68KB total in dist/electron/

PYTHON BACKEND:
- FastAPI app with SQLite database
- SwissEphemeris for astronomical calculations
- SQLAlchemy ORM, Pydantic for validation
- PyInstaller bundling: backend/backend.spec exists
- Compiled executable: backend/dist/backend (49MB)
- Hidden imports include: uvicorn, fastapi, pydantic, sqlalchemy, swisseph, passlib, jose

ENVIRONMENT VARIABLES (set by electron):
- PYTHONUNBUFFERED=1 (disable output buffering)
- USER_DATA_DIR (from app.getPath('userData'), typically ~/.config/theprogram)
- PORT=8000
- APP_ENV=development|production
- LOG_LEVEL=debug|info

VERIFIED WORKING (per ELECTRON_POC_SUMMARY.md):
✅ Electron window opens
✅ Python backend spawns from venv
✅ Frontend renders in window (cosmic background, beautiful UI)
✅ HTTP communication works (curl http://localhost:8000/health returns valid JSON)
✅ No CORS issues
✅ Graceful shutdown terminates all processes
✅ DevTools integration in dev mode

ISSUES RESOLVED:
1. Sandbox permission error → Added --no-sandbox flag for dev mode
2. Backend path resolution → Fixed __dirname navigation (up two levels from dist/electron/)
3. Python module not found → Use venv Python instead of system Python

BENEFITS vs DOCKER:
- Startup: 2-3s vs 15-20s (10x faster)
- CORS: None vs Constant complexity
- Development: Simple npm scripts vs docker-compose
- Distribution: Single executable vs Docker requirement
- Memory: ~393MB vs containerization overhead

CURRENT STATUS:
- Phase 1 (POC): ✅ COMPLETE
- Phase 2 (Production bundling): NOT STARTED
  - PyInstaller spec created but needs testing
  - Frontend production build integration needed
  - electron-builder packaging incomplete
- Phase 3 (Single-user enhancements): NOT STARTED
- Phase 4 (Distribution): NOT STARTED

KNOWN ISSUES:
- Frontend dev server hardcoded to localhost:3001 (no dynamic detection)
- Network error on login screen is expected (database not initialized for test mode)
- --no-sandbox used in dev (fine for development, production will use bundled mode)

Sylvia's astrological profile: Sun in 12th house Leo (spiritual service, ego dissolution, witness consciousness). 5-planet stellium in Virgo 1st house (Moon, Mercury, Mars, Uranus, Pluto - intense analytical, practical, transformative energy). Venus in 12th (hidden compassion). Lives on forest homestead, remote contractor, helping homeless person on property with dignity-based mutual aid. Philosophy: observer consciousness experiencing deterministic computation, "pretend I have free will but remember others don't", location as primary influence. Transformed profoundly in past year. Values practical wisdom over spiritual performance. Document: /home/sylvia/ClaudeWork/TheProgram/SYLVIA_ASTROLOGY_LIFE_PROFILE.md

Sylvia's refined cosmology: Light is fundamental (infinite granularity, continuous not digital). Meta-space contains infinite orbs (complete life-patterns). Brain = radio receiver tuning into meta-light. Consciousness tied to body (receiver). ALL lives experienced simultaneously by greater-consciousness (one ocean, infinite waves). No individual choice - greater-you IS everyone everywhere always. Death = receiver breaks, light returns to ocean. This resolves: he's helping homeless person = greater-you helping itself. Compassion is literal (same being). Model synthesized from: physics, meditation, neuroscience, direct experience. Aligns with Advaita Vedanta, block universe, Spinoza. Pragmatic: acts as if free will (self), remembers determinism (others). Location as primary lever for change.
